1983-09-03.snippet: Aspartame, the new low-calorie sweetener, has opened up a vast new consumer market.    Since last spring, when aspartame became nationally available in cereal, milk shake mix and diet colas, it has become an alternative to both saccharin and sugar...
1983-09-03.lead_paragraph: Aspartame, the new low-calorie sweetener, has opened up a vast new consumer market. Since last spring, when aspartame became nationally available in cereal, milk shake mix and diet colas, it has become an alternative to both saccharin and sugar. ''It is the first real substitute for sugar,'' said Kenneth Defren, a spokesman for the General Foods Corporation. Already, the new sweetener, discovered accidentally in 1965 by a chemist at G. D. Searle & Company, is being used by an increasing number of companies, including Borden Inc., General Foods, H. J. Heinz, Quaker Oats and Coca-Cola.
